alert.note: Alert for Union (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 25 at 10:29PM EDT until April 03 at 12:40AM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following river in Indiana... Kentucky...Illinois... Ohio River at Newburgh Dam, Mount Vernon, J.T. Myers Dam, and Shawneetown. .Recent heavy rainfall is resulting in rises on the Ohio River. The river is forecast to rise above flood stage at several locations. For the Ohio River...including Newburgh Dam, Mount Vernon, J.T. Myers Dam, Shawneetown...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON TO SUNDAY, APRIL 02... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ohio River at J.T. Myers Dam. * WHEN...From Monday afternoon to Sunday, April 02. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 28.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Monday afternoon to a crest of 40.4 feet Thursday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday, April 02. - Flood stage is 37.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
